Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Education and Science (Mr. Martin)
Speaker.P: I can inform the Deputy that Ballyhaise national school, County Cavan is not due to lose a teaching post for the 1998-99 school year. According to my Department's records, the teacher mentioned by the Deputy is not a member of the teaching staff of Ballyhaise national school.

Qst.hpid: Mr. R. Bruton Mr. R. Bruton
Qst.askee: Minister for Education and Science
Qst.Quest: if he has issued a grant to ACLD to assist in its work with parents and dyslexic children; and whether ACLD will be given a partnership role in developing a better planned service to cope with dyslexic children, many of whom are not being recognised in time or properly supported.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education and Science (Mr. Martin) Micheál Martin
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Education and Science (Mr. Martin)
Speaker.P: I can assure the Deputy that I am very much aware of the valuable work carried out by the Association for Children and Adults with Learning Disabilities. In 1997, my Department allocated a sum of £24,971 to the association towards the cost of their administration services and to facilitate access to workshops and summer schools organised by the association for children from disadvantaged areas. My Department is at present considering a request from the association for further funding in the current year. I hope to be in a position to respond to the association shortly. My Department is in ongoing contact with the association on matters of mutual concern and will continue to be available to meet representatives of the association where necessary.

Qst.hpid: Mr. R. Bruton Mr. R. Bruton
Qst.askee: Minister for Education and Science
Qst.Quest: his views on whether persons who have been teaching post leaving certificate courses satisfactorily for a specified period should be eligible to apply for permanent positions which come up where their qualifications are relevant to the course material even if they do not meet exact equivalence to a degree or diploma; and if he will clarify circular 32/92 to ensure this eligibility.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education and Science (Mr. Martin) Micheál Martin
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Education and Science (Mr. Martin)
Speaker.P: Permanent wholetime teacher appointments in the post-leaving certificate area are governed by the terms of circular letter 32/92. This states that the following qualifications are acceptable for permanent appointments in the PLC area: first, degree or equivalent in subjects relevant to the course; second, degree and either an appropriate qualification in an area relevant to the course or three years' approved experience, including industrial and teaching experience, in the appropriate area; or third, qualifications other than those mentioned which would be acceptable for posts in the colleges sector.

In accordance with the provisions of the agreement on teachers pay and conditions under the PCW, my Department is in the process of setting up a committee to determine suitable qualifications within the framework set out in CL 32/92 for appointment to permanent posts.

Qst.askee: Minister for Education and Science
Qst.Quest: the plans, if any, he has to improve the pupil-teacher ratio and staffing levels in a school (details supplied) in County Meath; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education and Science (Mr. Martin) Micheál Martin
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Education and Science (Mr. Martin)
Speaker.P: The staffing of a school is determined by the enrolment of the school at 30 September of the preceding year. The authorised staffing of the school referred to by the Deputy is a principal and one teacher. This staffing is based on an enrolment of 25 pupils at the school on 30 September 1997. Accordingly, I regret it is not open to me to allocate an additional teaching post to the school.

Qst.askee: Minister for Education and Science
Qst.Quest: if he will reverse his Department's decision to reduce the number of teachers in a school (details supplied) in County Meath in view of the fact that this school is in a rural area and in serious need of the third teacher; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education and Science (Mr. Martin) Micheál Martin
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Education and Science (Mr. Martin)
Speaker.P: The staffing of a school is determined by the enrolment in the school at 30 September of the preceding school year. A teaching post at the school referred to by the Deputy will be lost at the end of the current school year because the enrolment at the school declined from 56 pupils in September 1996 to 49 pupils in September 1997. The figure for the retention of the post is 55 pupils. Unfortunately, in light of the overall enrolment decline at the school, I am not in a position to authorise the retention of the post at the school.
